Routing tutorial

When Mvcjs starts processing a requested URL, the first step it takes is to parse the URL into a route The route is then used to instantiate the corresponding controller action to handle the request. This whole process is called routing.

Routes

End users address actions through the so-called routes. A route is a string that consists of the following parts:

  • a controller ID: a string that uniquely identifies the controller among all controllers within the same application (or the same module if the controller belongs to a module);
  • an action ID: a string that uniquely identifies the action among all actions within the same controller.

Routes take the following format: ControllerID/ActionID

Static routes

All routes are executed in order as thy are defined!

router.add([ { pattern: 'user/<view:(\\d+)>', // matches /user/1, /user/2 route: 'user/view' // controller user action view }, { pattern: 'home/<action>', // matches /home/index /home/contact route: 'home/<action>' // controller home action any }, { pattern: 'contact', // matches /contact route: 'home/contact' // controller home action contact }, { pattern: '<controller>/<action>', // matches /home/index /user/index /user/view route: '<controller>/<action>' // controller any action any }, { pattern: 'user/<action:(create|view|update|delete)>', // matches /user/create /user/view /user/update /user/delete route: 'user/<action>' // controller user action (create|view|update|delete) }, { pattern: 'user/<action:(update|view|delete)>/<id:(\\d+)>', // matches /user/update/5 /user/view/10 /user/delete/1000 route: 'user/<action>' // controller user action (update|view|delete) } ]); router.add({ pattern: '/', // matches / route: 'home/index' // controller home action index });

Dynamic routes

router.add([ { dynamic: true, constructor: di.load('@{envPath}/dynamic-router') } ]); router.add({ pattern: '/', // matches / route: 'home/index' // controller home action index });

Dynamic router:

var di = require('mvcjs'), RouteRuleInterface = di.load('interface/routeRule'), menuModel = di.load('@{modelsPath}/menu'), Promise = di.load('promise'), MenuRoute; MenuRoute = RouteRuleInterface.inherit({}, { parseRequest: function(method, route) { return new Promise(function (resolve, reject) { menuModel.findOne({link: route.pathname}, function(err, data) { if (!!data && !!data.route) { resolve([data.route, route.query]); // route must be returned as array format ['home/index', {id: 1}] string, object params }else { resolve(false); } }); }); }, createUrl: function(route, params) { if (route === 'custom/route') { // match route if (params.link) { return params.link; // return custom link from params } } return false; /* Eg: { "title": "Routing", "link": "/getting-started/routing", "route": "custom/route", // controller custom action route "blank": false } */ } }); module.exports = MenuRoute;

Components

Components host a set of the so-called application components that provide different services for processing requests.
For example, the core/router component is responsible for routing Web requests to appropriate controllers; the core/db component provides mogodb services; and so on.
All components are singleton objects in system.

Core Components

  • core/logger
  • core/router
  • core/favicon
  • core/view
  • core/assets
  • db/mongo
  • cache/memory

Bootstrapping Components

As mentioned above, an application component will only be instantiated when it is being accessed the first time.
Usually that is happening at bootstrapping application but thy can be bootstrapped at some controller model.
You can always override default core component and provide own implementation of some core component.

Bootstraping over environment.json

"components": [ { "name": "core/logger", "enabled": true, "write": true, "publish": true, "console": false, "port": 9001, "file": "server.log" }, { "name": "core/router", "errorRoute": "core/error" }, { "name": "core/favicon", "path": "@{basePath}/favicon.ico" }, { "name": "core/view", "themes": "@{appPath}/themes/", "views": "@{appPath}/views/", "theme": "default", "cache": false }, { "name": "core/assets", "path": "@{basePath}/storage/", "hook": "^\\/assets" }, { "name": "db/mongo", "connection": "mongodb://localhost/testdb" } ]
